title: Building Butcher’s Bridge: the Bilgewater event

replies.body:
> we’re still exploring post-event options.

I think ideally maybe randomize which map you get post-event? That way people that like The Howling Abyss don't feel screwed by replacing their map, but people that love the new map also get to enjoy it after the event.

Though what that probably means is, "We're trying to figure out how much to charge for this map skin."
Or...they could simply make the mode 1v1/2v2. We desperately need a mode to hone our laning prowess.

They'll probably turn it into a cannon ball instead

Edit: just because I've been getting a lot of messages about this, yes, they turned it into an orange instead :P. The turrets are now cannons
champion knockback. disengage instead of engage? might be interesting.

This would work.

That being said, ARAM isn't really serious, and it's a short match only. If Riot could make a bunch of different random ARAM maps (this being the first) with small but noticeable quirks, it would be awesome.
They should replace it with A BOTTLE OF RUM! {{champion:41}} {{champion:41}} {{champion:41}}
Dying in a teamfight? Eat oranges and be k
{{champion:17}}  shroom, it was k {{champion:41}}

ARAM definitely needs a fresher look, like the occasional winter and holloween SR maps we used to get from time to time. 

But in my opinion, Riot definitely needs to add a new game mode to fit with the theme of Bilgewater; a town that's full of seedy characters, pirates and sea monsters should be used for a free-for-all game mode, or at least a game mode where you collect bounties for certain targets on the enemy team that you're assigned to eliminate. You could maybe even have more than 2 teams (like 3 teams of 2 or 3), each trying to collect as many points as they can within a time limit (or reach certain win-conditions like in the cancelled magma chamber map).

And a 1v1/2v2 map in Bilgewater would be pretty cool too. 

Whatever you decide riot, it should be fun!! :)

BRING BACK 1V1 / 2V2 MODES!!!!!!!!!!! YIS PLS ANYTHING!!!!

Legit, those were the most fun times i had playing league during the 2v2 event on the aram map. Ive played this game for 6 years now and yes, that was the most fun thing i've done in this game.
You have the tools to do 1v1 and 2v2 in custom already. The game just doesn't tell you 'VICTORY' when u kill them.
Im talking about a dedicated matchmaking queue for it.
THAT was more fun than urf???

Honestly? Yeah...

Urf is just a shit show where you just roll your face on your keyboard, 2v2 showed how well you know how to lane in the early levels with each individual champion. And then even more fun when you played with a friend to mix and match the most oddest of champs in a single lane to have it be 2v2.

Can you imagine playing back when you started this game and not caring what the meta was? you would just go bot with lee sin / rengar... or blitzcrank and shaco? or cho and malz?

It was Really... really FUUNNN!
I honestly think Riot should make a new FFA map. I think it would be a really fun idea and if they do make it, it'll be used a lot. :D
^ THIS IS AN AMAZING IDEA

Completely agree, it'd be a shame to see this awesome looking map go away after the event was over. If you joined an ARAM and had like a 50/50 chance of playing on either map that'd be pretty nice to see.

I agree with this.  Kind of like when you would randomly get regular Summoner's Rift and autumn Rift, but with actual differences.

Adding random maps to the mix of ARAM brings a fresh breath of random :D
This definitely needs to become part of the normal rotation of aram maps. I love arams and play them regularly, and still enjoy the Howling Abyss, but a fresh map to rotate to would be welcome.

> [{quoted}](name=Raznald,realm=NA,application-id=Ag8jgd8Q,discussion-id=ETI4EBvT,comment-id=0010,timestamp=2015-06-25T01:54:22.311+0000)
>
> but you guys couldnt finish magma chamber?..

The second Magma Chamber had a completely new mode to go with it.  They tested that mode on an event.  The mode has, thus far, been the least popular featured mode since.
I don't know if it was because it was actually unpopular, or people didn't wanna play it because it didn't come with the new map, or what.
The first Magma Chamber wasn't finished, because it was larger than SR (About 175% its size, almost double the size of SR), and felt it'd draw away from the classic mode too much.

It wasn't the "least popular event," they made that assumption based on "time played" which was obviously not the best statistic as the games only averaged between 2 minutes and 15 minutes.  Compared to the other game modes, 1v1/2v2 matches were only a fraction of the length, but more widely played during the event.  To be honest, it looks like it's been played more than URF when they brought it back.

It's still being played on the HA in certain 1v1/2v2 tourneys that are online (with the same rules).
